title: 1. Who can apply for the Spark Program?
content: Anyone with a great idea can apply, including individuals, teams, and developers from any background. We value creativity and execution ability above all else.

title: 2. How fast is the application process?
content: Extremely fast. You can expect a final decision from our committee within one week of submitting your application. Our goal is to get you building, not waiting.

title: 3. What is the typical grant size?
content: Spark grants are designed to be quick and lightweight, typically up to $1,000 USD. Exceptionally impactful projects may be considered for up to $2,000. The goal is to fund a specific prototype or validation phase within 1-2 months.

title: 4. Are there restrictions on how the funds can be used?
content: We offer flexibility. Funds can be used for technical development, initial user testing and acquisition, or basic operational needs like content creation. The key is that the usage must directly support the project goals stated in your application.

title: 5. What stage should my project be at to apply?
content: The Spark Program is specifically for early-stage ideas and concepts. It's perfect if you want to build your first Proof-of-Concept, validate a core assumption, or iterate on a very early demo. For more mature projects seeking larger funding, we encourage you to apply to the Community Fund DAO after completing a Spark grant.
